question_1.question: What is the primary purpose of deployment in TimeXtender?

options.option_b: To generate scripts for creating tables and associated stored procedures

question_1.explanation: Deployment in TimeXtender is used to take table definitions from the TimeXtender Desktop and generate scripts that create tables and their associated stored procedures in the data area storage.

question_2.question: What are the two processes commonly performed one after the other in TimeXtender?
question_2.explanation: Deploy and Execute are two separate processes in TimeXtender that are commonly performed one after the other via the Deploy and Execute command to create and populate tables in the SQL database.

question_3.question: What is the primary purpose of executing tables in TimeXtender?

options.option_a: To modify the structure of existing tables
options.option_b: To transfer and cleanse data into tables that have been deployed
options.option_c: To generate reports from the data
options.option_d: To create new tables without transferring data

question_3.explanation: Execution of tables in TimeXtender is done to transfer and cleanse data into tables that have already been deployed, ensuring the data is ready for use.

question_4.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the execution of tables in TimeXtender?

options.option_b: Transferring data from the ODX Store to Raw tables
options.option_c: Creating new tables in the SQL database

question_4.explanation: Creating new tables is part of the deployment process, not the execution process. Execution involves transferring and cleansing data in already deployed tables.

question_5.question: What is the primary purpose of an execution package in TimeXtender?

options.option_b: To determine which objects in an instance will be executed and how
options.option_d: To log execution times and row counts only

question_5.explanation: An execution package in TimeXtender is used to define which objects in an instance will be executed and the manner of their execution, not just for scheduling notifications or logging data.

question_6.question: In TimeXtender, what restriction applies when adding tasks to a job?

options.option_a: Tasks from different ODX instances can be added to the same job
options.option_b: A job can contain both execution packages and ODX tasks
options.option_c: Only tasks relating to one ODX instance can be added to a job
options.option_d: There are no restrictions on adding tasks to a job

question_6.explanation: In TimeXtender, a job can only contain tasks from one ODX instance, and cannot include both execution packages and ODX tasks in the same job.
